result.execSummary:
The defendant Braeden Robert Chriske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
CORRECTED 09-29-2016 TO ADD EXPUNGEMENT LANGUAGE

Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation. Must be 100% compliant.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. No contact, directly or indirectly, with Dayton Peterson, Nathan Kristopeit, or MW. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt: CORRECTED TO ADD EXPUNGEMENT LANGUAGE TO CT 2

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Braeden Robert Chriske in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Chris Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State - no additions or corrections to PSI.  Chapter 950 - per victim's request, court attempted to contact victim by phone for statement but obtained voicemail.
Defense had provided letter with additions/corrections to PSI, no others today.

State requests withheld sentence with 3 years probation. Defense indicates deal with state was 2-3 years probation with expungement, state agrees.
Defense requests 2-3 years probation with expungement.  

BTC:  ct 2: withheld sentence 2 years probation
no alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent
full time employment or employment/school
no contact directly or indirectly with Dayton Peterson, Nathan Kristopeit or Michael Wakefield

ct 3 - withheld sentence - probation 1 year
same conditions - concurrent to count 2
Restitution of $910 joint and several with co-actors
Expungement - allowed only if 100% compliant with terms of probation
NO condition time.
Restitution to be paid during probation, may sue civilly.
charater letters for def to be used for sentencing
Atty Hall   RE: corrections to the PSI
Letter to Defendant RE: Bond Monitoring
Sentencing hearing on September 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
From DOC req extension of PSI due date

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:***MODIFIED 9/3/15 TO ALLOW DEFENDANT TO ATTEND SCHOOL AND MEDICAL/HEALTH APPOINTMENTS WHILE ON GPS***  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).  No contact with the co-defendant, DP and NK.   No contact with the victim, MSW (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 02-23-2016: GPS MAY BE REMOVED, HOWEVER DEFENDANT REMAINS ON HOUSE ARREST

**AMENDED 5-26-2016:  Defendant is granted a furlough from house arrest 6/26/16 - 7/10/16.**
Sentencing hearing on August 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
